intro: Argyreia bagshawei, commonly known as the pink morning glory, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking pink or purple flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped, velvety leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that attract pollinators. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
